instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message:
Hello guys 



Have got a 16 inches M1 Macbook Pro (820-02382) that is stuck in DFU MODE. The Logic board is spotless( very clean ) I went over the board and I couldn't find a short, PPDCIN is 5V PPBUS is 12.32V. PP3V3AON is present, an not sure exactly what method of troubleshooting to follow for an issue like this one, please help.

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message:
Did you try both revive and restore options?
Any error pops up?

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message: Thank you for reaching out, Yes I tried both options : the error I get is 4042

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message:
How the problem appeared?
Did you try DFU with both charger and battery connected?
You may have a problem with NAND chips...

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message: Thank you for responding to me. I tried with both battery and charger. When I got it from the client, connecting mag safe 3 has no LED.

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message: Did you try with USB-C charger too?

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message: Yes, I tried a USB C cable, but it still 5V, with the same behavior, also when I compared diode mode measurements on the SSD rail with a known working board, it checks out.

threads.title: 16 inches M1 820-02382  Stuck on DFU MODE.
threads.message:
DFU errors are not very clear; Apple did a "good" job.
All information is from experience of several technicians who posted on Internet.

A problem with a secondary power supply, should not impede you to complete DFU.
So M1 and NAND are the first suspects.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)#DFU_error_codes_and_troubleshooting[/URL]
